title: Another U.S. Lunar Lander Lifts Off
summary: A U.S. spacecraft is once again on its way to the Moon. If successful, it will be the first U.S. lunar lander since the Apollo era.  Pittsburgh-based Astrobotic tried last […]

title: Falcon 9 launches first Intuitive Machines lunar lander
summary: An Intuitive Machines spacecraft is on its way to the moon Feb. 15 in the company’s quest to be the first commercial entity to successfully land on the lunar surface.

title: Transitioning From ISS to Commercial Space Stations: Plenty of Questions, But Few Answers
summary: A congressional hearing today illuminated a wide range of policy issues awaiting resolution as the International Space Station nears its end, but the answers remain elusive. The ISS is expected […]

title: NASA selects ultraviolet astronomy mission but delays its launch two years
summary: NASA has selected an ultraviolet observatory for development but will delay its launch by two years because of budget challenges.

title: Varda gets reentry license for space manufacturing capsule
summary: After months of effort and one rejected application, Varda Space Industries said Feb. 14 it has received an FAA license for its first reentry capsule.
